Reason: The configuration option 'max_concurrent_automatic_sstable_upgrades' in the 'cassandra' software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact system performance. This configuration determines the maximum number of automatic SSTable upgrades that can occur concurrently, which directly affects the system's ability to efficiently manage and upgrade SSTables. A higher value may lead to increased resource consumption and longer execution times, while a lower value may limit the system's ability to optimize SSTable upgrades, resulting in performance degradation.
